title: Creative Writing Terms Quiz
description: From 'hook' to 'denouement,' test your knowledge of essential creative writing terminology

questions.question: What is a 'hook' in creative writing?
options: The final sentence of a story
An opening line or passage designed to capture the reader's attention immediately
A fishing scene at the start of a story
A plot twist in the middle of the story

questions.question: What does 'show, don't tell' mean?
options: Use illustrations instead of words
Only use descriptive passages
Reveal information through actions, sensory details, and dialogue rather than direct exposition
Tell the story through a slideshow

questions.question: What is a 'draft' in the writing process?
options: A type of ink used in writing
The final published version
A cold breeze while writing
A preliminary version of a written work, subject to revision

questions.question: What is 'world-building' in fiction?
options: The process of creating the detailed setting, rules, history, and culture of a fictional world
Construction work described in a story
Writing stories set in the real world
Building a library

questions.question: What is a 'narrative arc'?
options: An archway described in the narrative
The author's signature
The overall shape or trajectory of a story from beginning through middle to end
A type of boat in a story

questions.question: What does 'pacing' refer to in writing?
options: The number of pages in a book
The speed at which a story unfolds and how the writer controls the rhythm of events
How fast the reader can read
Walking while writing

questions.question: What is 'purple prose'?
options: Prose about royalty
A style of writing popular in the 1800s
Prose written with a purple pen
Writing that is excessively ornate, flowery, or overwrought

questions.question: What is an 'unreliable narrator'?
options: A narrator who tells a different story each time
A narrator who forgets to tell parts of the story
A narrator whose credibility is compromised, causing the reader to question their account
A narrator who is always late

questions.question: What is 'backstory'?
options: A story told backwards
The part of the story set behind a building
The story written on the back cover
The history and events that happened before the main story begins

questions.question: What is 'verisimilitude' in creative writing?
options: A type of simile
A type of verse
The appearance of being true or real, making fiction believable
A similarity between two characters

questions.question: What is a 'manuscript'?
options: A type of ancient scroll
An author's text of a work submitted for publication, before it becomes a published book
A script written by a man
A handwritten letter

questions.question: What does 'kill your darlings' mean in writing advice?
options: Be willing to cut beloved passages, characters, or ideas that do not serve the story
Write stories with dramatic death scenes
Only write villains
Avoid writing about characters you like

questions.question: What is a 'beta reader'?
options: A person who reads and provides feedback on a manuscript before publication
A reader who only reads the second chapter
A professional book critic
The second person to buy a book

questions.question: What is 'writer's block'?
options: A type of paragraph structure
An inability to produce new work or continue writing, often caused by creative stalling
A physical block used to prop up books
A neighborhood where writers live

questions.question: What is an 'epigraph' in a book?
options: A short quotation or saying placed at the beginning of a book or chapter to suggest its theme
The author's signature
A description of the cover art
A graph showing the plot structure
